title: Reds to interview Twins assistant GM
subtitle: Reds will interview Twins assistant GM
body: CINCINNATI -- On Thursday, the Twins granted permission for the Reds to interview assistant general manager Wayne Krivsky for their vacant GM's job.  The interview date and time was not revealed, but it will be held between Krivsky and Reds chief executive officer Bob Castellini some time next week in Cincinnati. The club did not release any other names of candidates.  Reds chief operating officer John Allen phoned Krivsky with the news Thursday afternoon. Mark Sheldon is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Mark Sheldon
